question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the generated code is executable for demonstration. Please help me create a comprehensive data dashboard for studying the impact of the digital economy on residential consumption in Hebei Province. It should include international internet users, registered population, and digital economy index. Output in HTML format and ensure the code is operational.

checklist.title: Is the dashboard data visualization system fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code accurately implements essential visualizations (charts, graphs, tables) for digital economy metrics and residential consumption data specific to Hebei Province. Score 0 if no visualization components are implemented, 5 if only basic charts without interactivity are included, and 10 if the dashboard contains comprehensive, interactive visualizations with proper labeling and legends.

checklist.title: Are all required data components and metrics incorporated?
checklist.description: Check whether the dashboard includes all specified data points: international internet users, registered population, and digital economy index for Hebei Province. Deduct 3 points for each missing metric. The visualization should properly contextualize these metrics in relation to residential consumption. If relationships between metrics aren't visually demonstrated, deduct 5 points. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is there an effective data filtering and comparison mechanism?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the dashboard provides tools for filtering data by time periods, regions within Hebei, or demographic segments. Check if comparison features allow contrasting different metrics or time periods. Deduct 3 points if filtering is limited to basic options, 5 points if comparison functionality is missing, and 5 points if historical trend analysis is not possible. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the dashboard include appropriate data visualization techniques for economic analysis?
checklist.description: Assess whether the code utilizes appropriate visualization types for economic data (line charts for trends, bar charts for comparisons, choropleth maps for regional distribution, etc.). Evaluate if correlation plots or regression analysis visualizations are included to show relationships between digital economy and consumption. Deduct 5 points if visualization types are inappropriate for the data, and 5 points if advanced analytical visualizations are missing. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as missing data, data loading errors, browser compatibility issues, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Predictive modeling visualizations 2. AI-driven insights highlighting 3. Interactive scenario planning tools). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant visualizations showing the same data in different formats without adding value 2. Unnecessary decorative elements that distract from the data 3. Resource-intensive animations or effects that slow dashboard performance without analytical benefit. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core economic analysis functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating data processing/visualization/UI components), code reusability, and optimization for dashboard performance. Deduct 5 points if global variable pollution is found; deduct 5 points if visualization libraries are implemented inconsistently; deduct 5 points if the code doesn't optimize for data loading and rendering performance. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the dashboard design follows data visualization best practices: 1) Appropriate color schemes for data encoding (colorblind-friendly, sequential/diverging palettes) 2) Proper information hierarchy and layout (most important metrics prominently displayed) 3) Clear typography system with appropriate sizing for headlines, labels, and values. Deduct 3 points for cluttered visualizations, 5 points for misleading visual encodings, and 5 points for poor information architecture. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dashboard interactions support effective data exploration: 1) Tooltips appear within 100ms on hover 2) Filter/selection changes reflect within 500ms 3) Smooth transitions when updating visualizations. Deduct 5 points for each interaction without visual feedback, 3 points for sluggish responses when filtering large datasets, and 5 points for confusing navigation between dashboard sections. The full score is 10 points.
